docs.snippet: Anyone who has played cornerback at any level, who has had to play man-to-man with no help, can identify with Sherman, the Seahawks’ dynamic, breast-beating All-Pro....
docs.lead_paragraph: Anyone who has played cornerback at any level, who has had to play man-to-man with no help, can identify with Sherman, the Seahawks’ dynamic, breast-beating All-Pro.
docs.abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of the Times column describes his experience playing left corner while at Morgan State University, where he developed a healthy contempt for cocky wide receivers; holds this makes it easy for him to identify with Seattle Seahawks cornerback Richard Sherman, who has gained attention for breast-beating trash talk following victory in NFC championship.

headline.main: Seahawks’ Richard Sherman, Like Cornerbacks Before Him, Plays Man-to-Man and Goes Toe to Toe
headline.print_headline: Playing Man-to-Man; Going Toe to Toe

docs.abstract: NFL Roundup; New York Giants, for the second time in a month, hire a quarterbacks coach from NFC North to help resurrect downtrodden offense; team names Craig Johnson as running backs coach; other football news noted.

headline.main: Giants Hire Another Assistant for Offense

docs.lead_paragraph: Wealthy football fans headed to next month's Super Bowl might find themselves scrambling to find parking for their private jets, with slots at a small airport near the stadium in New Jersey rapidly filling up, transportation officials said Thursday.
